assets_table¶

class tracktor_server.assets_table.Assets(db_name)¶

Bases: object

Class to manage connection to the backend Assets table.

This class provides methods to to write/read from a SQLite database directly, while main.py handles the requests and calls on these functions.

db_name¶

The name of the SQLite database file.

Type:

str

connection¶

The database connection.

Type:

sqlite3.Connection or None

add_asset_for_project(project_id, asset_name, asset_type)¶

Adds a new asset to the database.

Parameters:

  • project_id (int) – The ID of the project.

  • asset_name (str) – The name of the asset.

  • asset_type (str) – The type of the asset.

Returns:

The ID of the newly created asset.

Return type:

int

change_asset_status(asset_id, status_item, new_status)¶

Changes the status of any dropdown status item, aka LAY, ANI, etc.

Parameters:

  • asset_id (int) – The ID of the asset.

  • status_item (str) – The status column to update (e.g., ‘mod_status’).

  • new_status (str) – The new status value.

get_all_assets()¶

Gets all existing assets from the db.

Returns:

A list of all asset rows.

Return type:

list[sqlite3.Row]

get_asset_from_project(project_id, asset_id)¶

Gets all columns of one asset from one project.

Parameters:

  • project_id (int) – The ID of the project.

  • asset_id (int) – The ID of the asset.

Returns:

The asset row, or None if not found.

Return type:

sqlite3.Row

get_assets_from_project(project_id)¶

Get assets to display on the project page.

Parameters:

project_id (int) – The ID of the project.

Returns:

A list of asset rows for the project.

Return type:

list[sqlite3.Row]

get_db()¶

Opens the named database or creates one if it doesn’t exist.

Returns:

The db connection object.

Return type:

sqlite3.Connection

init_assets_table()¶

Creates and SQL table for assets if it doesn’t already exist.

remove_asset_from_project(asset_id)¶

Deletes a specific asset from the database.

Parameters:

asset_id (int) – The ID of the asset to remove.

remove_assets_from_project(project_id)¶

Removes all assets from the specified project.

Parameters:

project_id (int) – The ID of the project.

Tracktor VFX
